reviewText: Whatever happened to those days of old when enemies took one shot to die, you could learn their attack patterns and had to naviagte through structures on each level? *sigh* Well, this game is the mirror opposite. Enemies are erratic to the point of annoying and disappear off the screen before you hardly know they are there. The amount of hits they take to actually go down is a bit tedious and there was a cheap fly right into you" boss ship at the end of level 2! I also seemed to pick up bonuses or "upgrades" that seemed to have little or no effect! Right
date: I'm off for a game of R-Type!"

reviewText:
A good shmup with multiple modes and plenty of replay-ability.

The different modes of the game offer a good variety.

Story Mode plays as you would expect with some fun sequences and boss fights.
The classic mode gives a challenge which is very different in mechanics from most available shmups that i've played.

The best part for me personally is the survival -> blitz mode -> Turbo Difficulty!
Endless waves of intense action! Not sure why more shmups dont do this!

The graphics are a bit dated but have that classic pc/arcade charm.

I would like to see some more variety in the different ships beyond stats.

reviewText: A decent side scrolling shmup. 5 different game modes to play with 4 difficulties for each mode. You need to play through lower difficulties to unlock the higher ones. reviewText: This game controls very well and hit boxes make sense, but never buy this game at full price (or do its only $5), it's a rather lame game. There's only a few different types of enemies, only 3 different kinds of weapons, about 6 levels and the different types of ships hardly add any extra gameplay. The thing I disliked most about the game is that it is quite hard to see enemies against the terrain especially on a certain map, where it is almost mars like the smaller red bullets are also rather dificult to see.

reviewText: Not THAT bad but this one lacks ship customization/weapons loadout and the story mode is way too short. Your ship is way too big on the screen and the aliens fall in the we're ALL kamikaze" category. There are bullets to avoid but the biggest threat is the ships themselves. Some areas have bosses... models are fine but they don't give you any satisfaction to take down
date: no visual on how damaged they are
recommended: no phases or transformations. The whole story mode is bland and it feels like all levels are the same except for the background. Sometimes enemies come from the background
hoursPlayed:
ramming you from the depths of your screen as you're trying to figure out if you can even shoot them. I do love the ships firing FROM the background.. it kinda sets the climate for war although you won't know at which point their projectiles can actually hit you.

Other modes of play include "you shall not pass or i lose" where you fire a thin one shot kill laser on enemies that eventually move faster horizontally than you can move vertically.

Then comes the blitz modes where you must kill a fixed amount of enemies to go to the next wave. In this mode you soon find out that the screen is filled with ships that you can't kill with your strongest ship and your big ♥♥♥♥ get rammed by the swarm. Yes your hyper charges a little faster when not firing.... not firing
voteText: you're kidding right?\n\nI'm sure some people will like this game but i think it's missing A LOT to even start to be interesting.  There's some talent into this game but i'm expecting more than this in 2015."

reviewText:
Came for the local co-op and yes I liked it, graphics  are a little minimalstic the HUUUGE HUD should be reduced in size as it sometimes occludes enemies.

A very good approach of the dev not to overload gameplay options by introducing and increasing the ships weaponry level by level, thus not such a high learning curve as some other shmups tend to have. A shmup verteran will have an easy time with it, did I just write shmup veteran, lol I obviously did, err I am getting old.

Don't misjudge by the graphics, the core gameplay itself is very solid. The levels as well as the angle you play changes quite a lot, basically a very cool thing.

If you're into shmups and can live with the HUD and the minimalised style this is very much worth your time, especially in co-op.

Regards,
NicoNico

reviewText: Don't let the rough edges on the screenshots fool you - this is a polished shmup with responsive controls, interesting patterns and a good use of shifting perspectives due to the 3d engine.  Lots of ships to use, each of which feels different.  The Training difficulty allows even casual players to reach the end of the campaign, while the toughest settings can be quite challenging.  In addition to the short campaign, there are randomly generated levels and other modes.  Good value, good fun. Recommended.
